subject: What happened to o?
msgSnippet: So, in the dictionary that s posted on this group, I did a search for the (jerome.ttf) letter o , and found *nothing*.  Even the guide words Ox and On are
messageBody:
So, in the dictionary that's posted on this group, I did a search for the (jerome.ttf) letter "o", and found *nothing*. Even the guide words Ox and On are spelled "yks" and "yn".

Since I never Received my Pronunciation, I am at a lost as to how to pronounce "o", since I myself pronounce Ox and On differently.

Anyone here want to help me out?

I think I have it, from all the examples in the manual, but I keep getting confused with the nearby vowels "y" and "Y".

Anyways, stealing a word from "Ride a-cock Horse," I've come up with a mnemonic for four of the vowels:

a cross
exam

a kros
egzAm

Write it out in Quikscript and the four vowels form the four quarters of a circle.

And for the diphthongs:
cowboy's
gravesite

(There are in fact a lot of words for E+F, but finding a Q+q word leaves me with Cowboy and Mountjoy...)

So, in the dictionary that's posted on this group, I did a search for the (jerome.ttf) letter "o", and found *nothing*.  Even the guide words Ox and On are spelled "yks" and "yn".

Since I never Received my Pronunciation, I am at a lost as to how to pronounce "o", since I myself pronounce Ox and On differently.

Anyone here want to help me out?

I think I have it, from all the examples in the manual, but I keep getting confused with the nearby vowels "y" and "Y".

Anyways, stealing a word from "Ride a-cock Horse," I've come up with a mnemonic for four of the vowels:

a cross
exam

a kros
egzAm

Write it out in Quikscript and the four vowels form the four quarters of a circle.

And for the diphthongs:
cowboy's
gravesite

(There are in fact a lot of words for E+F, but finding a Q+q word leaves me with Cowboy and Mountjoy...)
